intro: Dichapetalum deflexifolium, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
